meanings.definition: To throw or cast something quickly or suddenly.
meanings.sent1: He jaculates the ball into the basket.
meanings.sent2: She jaculates the dice onto the game board.
meanings.sent3: The magician jaculates the cards into the air, making them disappear.
meanings.sent4: The chef jaculates the spices into the sizzling pan, creating a burst of aroma.
meanings.sent5: The child jaculates the paint onto the canvas, creating a colorful masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To ejaculate or emit fluid forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The fountain jaculates water into the air.
meanings.sent2: The whale jaculates water from its blowhole.
meanings.sent3: The water gun jaculates a stream of water at the target.
meanings.sent4: The geyser jaculates hot water high into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The fire hydrant jaculates water with great pressure during emergencies.
